description: From Latin hyalinus, from Koine Greek ὑάλινος (huálinos), from ὕαλος (húalos, “glass”).

adjectives.description: hyaline (comparative more hyaline, superlative most hyaline)

examples: And, as below she braids her hyaline hair, / Eyes her soft smiles reflected in the air  […] .

entries.meaning: (poetic) Anything glassy, translucent or transparent; the sea or sky.
examples: Our blood runs amazed 'neath the calm hyaline.

entries.meaning: (zoology, anatomy) A clear translucent substance in tissues.
(biochemistry) The main constituent of the walls of hydatid cysts; a nitrogenous body, which, by decomposition, yields a dextrogyrate sugar, susceptible to alcoholic fermentation.
examples: where a villus comes next to a gland the short cubical cells of the gland may be traced into the columnar cells of the villus , the hyaline border becoming more marked
